data.title: Not worth a visit
data.text: Sure this is a historic place to go and eat, but I found the prices high and nothing on the menu worth a second visit.  We went for breakfast and the service was a little below average and the food nothing special.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Had breakfast here Saturday morning while visiting my daughter. The food was great and the service was very fast and friendly! We will definitely go back!

data.title: great down-home diner
data.text: Rod's has been a staple in Arcadia for many years.  I grew up in the area and used to go here while in high school.  After being away for 50 years and coming back to Rod's, I'm even more enamored of the place.  Great food and good service enable places like Rod's to survive for decades.  Loved my breakfast there and will come back often.

data.title: Great food and food for people with allergies
data.text: They cook with canola oil, not soybean oil ... that is a big YIPPEE you're allergic to soy.  It is totally recognizable as a place where they filmed some Mad Men scenes ... That was kind of cool.  The decor is retro with a lot of wonderful vintage photos, and they play 50s hits.  Service was awesome.   Went there for breakfast and had the pork verde omelet.  The only problem was that the menu said no cheese, and it had cheese (another allergy for me), but I'm not holding it against them ... I should have asked.  I'll definitely go back.  It's right by Santa Anita Raceway, anddddd my surgeon's office.

data.title: Must Visit In Arcadia!
data.text: First stop in Arcadia for my California vacation from New York was at Rod's where I was greeted by Julie who treated me like gold. For my 10 days in Arcadia, I dined here almost every day. Waitresses are phenomenal especially Julie, Karen, Bonnie and Maria. They were very attentive and loved to chat. One morning I saw Maria bring hot food to a booth with no one sitting at it. As soon as she finished, a distinguished man entered to seat himself at this very table, he looked at me and commented, "Now this is service and they've been doing this for me for 15 years!" Remarkable. So remarkable I had the waitresses autograph a menu for me, I framed it and hung it up in my home.

data.title: Breakfast & retro vibes
data.text: Had a great breakfast w the family.  Didn't take long to sit down w a larger party, very attentive service.  Loved the retro diner and was easy to get to.

data.title: Really Great Place
data.text: Service at Rods is amazing always the best. Great location, across from Mercedes Benz Dealer. Food is so good and fairly affordable. I'll be back really soon.

data.title: Rod's Grill, a local legend.
data.text: We dine here frequently, they have large portions, cook everything consistently, great specials, friendly atmosphere and family loved! Manny, the owner, is the soul of Rod's Grill and is always somewhere supervising, getting to know people and smiling at repeat diners!

data.title: Lovely old fashioned diner with good, fresh food, and great service
data.text:
Great old fashioned diner with fresh roast turkey breast for their sandwiches.  Used to go to a long-ago-closed location, and pleasantly surprised to find this! They even still have liver and onions on the menu, which I used to get long before it fell out of fashion.  Friendly service, great food, very reasonable prices.  It's about 35 miles from home, but I'll come back, even if it's out of the way.  Entrees come with soup or salad, and even "light desert" (ice cream or tapioca pudding).

So glad they're still around!!

data.title: Step Back in Time at Rod's with a Great Breakfast!
data.text:
Rod's has been here in this location across from Arcadia Park since the 1950's, when my family used to come here and I was just a child.  The decor is now dated, but it's oddly enough just like it was in 1956 when I have my first memories of eating here, and I like that old ambiance in spite of it really needing a freshening renovation.  But it's obviously not going to get it, and it doesn't matter to the customers that have been coming here for 50 years.

The food is traditional American, there's a huge number of breakfast dishes and everything you'd ever want for breakfast.  I really enjoyed my rare visit here, as I no longer live in Southern California and don't visit the area often.  But Rod's was like walking into a good memory.  The breakfast was very good, if I lived around Arcadia I'd go here at least once a week.  The service is excellent, too.

data.title: Friendly Owner
data.text: Great Oldies restaurant.  The owner comes around and visits some of the patrons.  I like their home potatoes with their breakfasts.  Service was great.  It is not a health food restaurant, but great breakfast.  Close to Santa Anita race track, so it gets crowded on race days.

data.title: Blast from the past
data.text: We walked in here and the decor food and music took us to another time. Vintage photos complete the story. Great home fries and hash browns bicuits and gravy on the side nice omelettes.

data.title: Really, really good coffee shop
data.text: Coffee shops can blend together, but this place pays attention to small details.  Good coffee (shock), and they butter the breakfast bread while it's still hot!  Huge detail for me... Food sounds ordinary but tastes really good.  Owners stood strong against the city a few years back when faced with forced sale of their property, so it's a "mom and pop" kind of place.  They care about their community.  Go here if you actually care about how your food tastes at a coffee shop.

data.title: Great diner
data.text: Small, "throw-back" diner.  Good service - food was very tasty & served quickly.  The apple / sausage omelet was very interesting & tasty.  Will definitely go back again

data.title: Cozy little diner on Route 66
data.text: I return again and again to this friendly little diner on Route 66. They aim to please, and it's a happy atmosphere! Often used as filming location and I can see why--authentic mid-century architecture (and a cool vintage chef sign!) that really makes you feel like you stepped back in time.

data.title: good homely food in an old 60,s american diner a nice atmosphere and food is cooked in front of you while you wait and i
data.text: it made a fresh difference to Dennys which is a burger joint up the road and is located in downtown Arcadia

data.title: Retro diner is very welcoming
data.text: Nice to see a place that is not corporate or Franchise. Rods has great food, fast service, and Manny the manager is on the go. Yesterday I brought in a group of 15. Service, price and food was the best, and we will all return!!  Thank you.

data.title: Flashback
data.text: Good, average coffee shop food.  We had breakfast and enjoyed it.  This restaurant has been in Arcadia forever; great memories.

data.title: Awesome retro diner
data.text: We've gone to this diner for over 5 years now and have always had a great time.  What's really cool about this diner (other than the awesome staff and food) is that it's kept preserved in a true retro style from when it was originally built decades ago.  It's almost like stepping back in time, everything such as the decor, the booths, the clock on the wall is kept in such great shape; even the vintage heat lamps and the old school cash register.  When you sit down, you'll notice pictures on the wall dating back to the mid and early 20th century to show the history of Arcadia.  The food is good old fashioned American diner eating.  I haven't tried everything on the menu, but the breakfast items were a gold standard for me and the BLT is great is wanting something not as filling, but still craving the bacon!  The pricing is fair and the coffee is always flowing.  I hope this diner is around for years to come.  Try the waffles, they're absolutely delicious.

data.title: Standard Coffee Shop
data.text: I always enjoy patronizing non-franchise restaurants when I can. This one definitely fits the bill and is much loved by the community. I had always heard that they served a superb breakfast so I went for breakfast and was a little underwhelmed. It was fine. But certainly not as good as I expected. The eggs were a little over cooked and the bacon was a bit limp. But it was still fine. Since there's always a line of people waiting to get in for breakfast, I don't think the occasional unimpressive breakfast will hurt them. I would still go here for the service and homey atmosphere.
